WWW.JACKPOTPARTY.COM Cookie Policy

Introduction

A cookie is a small file of letters and numbers that, with your consent, we store on your browser or the hard drive of your computer. Most websites use cookies and similar technologies in order to function, or work more efficiently, as well as to provide useful information to the website operator.

Cookies enable us to distinguish you from other users. This helps us to provide you with a good experience when you browse the jackpotparty.com site (the “Site”). Cookies also enable us to count the number of visitors to the Site and see how visitors move around the Site. This helps us to improve the way the Site works, for example by ensuring that users can easily find what they’re looking for.

We also recommend that you read our Privacy Policy to learn about what personal information we collect through the Site and how we use it.

Your consent to the use of cookies

By visiting the Site, creating an account or logging in, you consent to us using cookies as described in this policy.

You can withdraw your consent for us to use cookies by modifying the settings in your web browser in order to disable cookies. However, please note you may not be able to use all the interactive features of the Site if cookies are disabled. Unless you have adjusted your browser settings so that it will refuse cookies, by using the Site, you will be consenting to the use of cookies as described in this policy. For more information about cookies, including how to enable/disable them see www.allaboutcookies.org.

Please note that we do not save any personally identifiable information via cookies.

The different types of cookies we use

Session Cookies: One type is a so-called 'session cookie'. During the period you are online and surfing on the Site, cookies are sent between your computer and the server in order to be able to link information, such as what language you have chosen, for example. Session cookies allow you to carry information across pages of the Site and avoid having to re-enter information. They are also used within registration to allow you to access stored information. Session cookies are not permanently stored on your computer, but disappear when you close your browser.

Persistent Cookies: The other type of cookie we use is stored for a limited period on your computer. One of the purposes of persistent cookies is to save the log-in name of registered members. This is a service designed to help registered members to log-in more speedily. This cookie can only be read by our server. We also use persistent cookies for the following purposes:

  • To help us recognise you as a unique visitor when you return to the Site and to allow us to tailor content or advertisements to match your preferred interests or to avoid showing you the same adverts repeatedly.
  • To compile anonymous, aggregated statistics that allow us to understand how people use the Site and to help us improve the structure of the Site.
  • To internally identify you by account name, name, email address, user ID, currency and location (geographic and computer ID/IP address).
  • To differentiate between users who are on the same network to enable us to correctly allocate winnings to the appropriate account.
  • Within research surveys to ensure you are not invited to complete a questionnaire too often or after you have already done so.

Third parties may also serve cookies via the Site

Please note that our advertisers may also use cookies, over which we have no control. These are normally used for the following purposes:

  • To serve advertisements on the Site and track whether these advertisements are clicked on by users.
  • To control how often you are shown a particular advertisement.
  • To tailor content to your preferences.
  • To count the number of anonymous users of the Site.
  • For website usage analysis.

Web Beacons:

Some of the pages on the Site contain electronic images known as Web Beacons (also known as “clear gifs”). These allow us to count users who have visited these pages. Web Beacons collect only limited information which includes a cookie number, time and date of a page view, and a description of the page on which the Web Beacon resides. We may also carry web beacons placed by third party advertisers. These beacons do not carry any personally identifiable information and are only used to track the effectiveness of a particular advertising campaign.

Changes to this Cookie Policy

We may modify, alter or otherwise update this Cookie Policy at any time. We will post any new or revised policy on the Site. We therefore recommend that you revisit this Cookie Policy to ensure you have read the latest version. Your continued use of the Site will constitute acceptance of any such changes.

Contacting Us

If you would like more details about the way we use cookies on the Site, please contact us by email to support@jackpotparty.com
